article.headline: Furman 73, Western Carolina 68
article.story: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) --Robby Bostain's jumper broke a 64-all tie and sent Furman on to a 73-68 victory against Western Carolina to open the Southern Conference tournament Wednesday. The Paladins (17-11) take on East Tennessee State, which had the league's best record at 24-5, in Thursday's quarterfinals. And it wouldn't have happened without Bostain's clutch play at the end. Furman led 60-42 with 9:20 left, but the Catamounts (13-15) -- behind nine points by Corey Muirhead -- went on a 22-4 run over the next five minutes to tie the game. Both teams missed several chances to go in front before Bostain drove right of the basket and put up a running 8-footer that bounced off the rim and went through. Bostain then stepped in front of a pass on Western Carolina's next possession. Quan Prowell, the Southern Conference's freshman of the year, followed with a three-point play to put the Paladins ahead 69-64 with 49 seconds left. Maleye Ndoye had five 3-pointers and led Furman with 25 points. Kevin Martin, the league's top scorer at better than 25 points a game, led Western Carolina with 18 points. But he continued his late-season struggles going 7-of-18 from the floor and just 1-of-6 on 3-pointers.
